/- Proposition 3.23: (Basic properties of convolution) Let `f,g,h : ` be continuous functions with compact support, and define `(f*g)(x) = t, f (x - t) * g t`. Then: (1) `f*g` is continuous and has compact support; (2) (Commutativity) for all `x`, `(f*g)(x) = (g*f)(x)`; (3) (Linearity) for all `x`, `(f*(g+h))(x) = (f*g)(x) + (f*h)(x)`, and for any `c` and all `x`, `(f*(c g))(x) = ((c f)*g)(x) = c (f*g)(x)`. -/
